CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 21, 1967, pg. 17, reads: "STRIKING - Two of the most striking outfits modeled at the NULBA [National United Licensed Beverage Association] Fashion Show at Chatham Center, were designed and created by Alberta Thompson (left). She is wearing a black velvet form - fitting Chinese style ensemble with matching hat trimmed in rhinestones. Long dangling rhinestone earrings completed her attire.  The white brocade coat trimmed in feathers worn by Glora [sic] Grate was also created by the talented and pretty Alberta. - Harris Photo."The ostrich feather trimmed coat that Gloria Golden Grate is holding was made by Alberta Thompson, seamstress and the first model from Pittsburgh hired as a part of the Ebony Fashion Fair.
TitMainTitle: Gloria Golden Grate holding brocade coat trimmed in ostrich feathers, standing with Mr. McCaskill in booth with ties, hats, suits, handkerchiefs, and sign on curtain reading "The Village Gate Shop" for NULBA [Tavern Owners] fashion show, Chatham Center
